docs.lead_paragraph: What was striking about Dr. Sacks was his capacity for enthusiasm about whatever idea or object had caught his attention.

headline.main: Oliver Sacks: Diverse Elements in Harmony

docs.abstract: Erica Goode Essay column offers appreciation of Dr Oliver Sacks, neurologist and author who died on August 31; notes that what made him so striking a person was his capacity for enthusiasm across wide range of interests.
docs.snippet: What was striking about Dr. Sacks was his capacity for enthusiasm about whatever idea or object had caught his attention.

docs.lead_paragraph: The country sees success in its 15-year campaign against lockjaw, in part by providing incentives for mothers to give birth in clean conditions

headline.main: India Virtually Eliminates Tetanus as a Killer
headline.print_headline: India Eliminates Tetanus as a Deadly Threat

docs.abstract: India announces that, after 15-year effort, it has reduced cases of tetanus to less than one per 1,000 births, virtually eliminating disease that has been killer of newborn infants and mothers delivering their babies at home.
docs.snippet: The country sees success in its 15-year campaign against lockjaw, in part by providing incentives for mothers to give birth in clean conditions

docs.lead_paragraph: An analysis of dust from 1,200 homes across the continental United States provides new information about the fungal and bacterial communities within.

headline.main: A Home’s Story, Told in Dust, Bacteria and Fungi
headline.print_headline: Microbiology: A Home’s Story, Told in Dust, Bacteria and Fungi

docs.abstract: Dr Noah Fierer study of house dust published in Proceedings of the Royal Society B finds that types of bacteria in houses varied based on female-to-male ratio of residents and if pets lived there, but notes that indoor fungi grows based on location of home.
docs.snippet: An analysis of dust from 1,200 homes across the continental United States provides new information about the fungal and bacterial communities within.

keywords.value: Proceedings of the Royal Society B (Journal)
keywords.name: organizations
